did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: East Lyme Landmarks and Institutions Collection
did.abstract: The collection contains information about East Lyme landmarks and institutions, including historic houses, mills, schools, churches, memorials and monuments quarries, a women's prison, and a National Guard camp.
did.physloc:
East Lyme Room at the East Lyme Public Library.
Cabinet 7, shelf 2: Historic house inventories, schools, mills, quarries, and veterans memorials and monuments; shelf 3: churches and State Farm for Women (now York Correctional Institution); shelf 4: The Thomas Lee House.
Cabinet 9, shelf 2: National Guard Camp

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: East Lyme is located in the southeastern part of Connecticut on Long Island Sound. Formed from parts of Lyme and Waterford and incorporated as a town in 1839, East Lyme includes two villages, Flanders in the northern part of town and Niantic along the coast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection contains documentation on the following topics:
LC002: Original school districts in East Lyme, Connecticut. Box contains maps of the school districts, information about the original nine schools, school records and town reports.
LC003: Past mills of East Lyme, Connecticut. Descriptions of the 19 various mills in the Town of East Lyme.
LC004: Old granite quarries of East Lyme Notes and miscellaneous articles about granite quarries
LC005: Veteran Memorial and Monuments of East Lyme information, history and location of each memorial or monument.

arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by topic and sub-topic.
